page.title: 16Memories-Mrs.Bradley,Lydden
page.content: Although this interview contains much historical information we feel that it is worthy of inclusion as it stands. On June 26th Emma,Clive,Daniel and Mr. Marshall visited Mrs.Bradley who lives at 57,Canterbury Rd,Lydden.Mrs.Bradley has lived in Lydden for 80 years.She was born in 1905.Mrs.Bradley remembers quite vividly the Peace Day celebrations of May 12th 1919.The children marched to a meadow at Bell Farm carrying Union flags.There were all kinds of activities.The farmers put up swings in four big elm trees.There were races for those of 70 years and over.The men raced for the white linen cloths which covered the tables and the ladies raced for the big brown tea pots.The adults sat at the tables for tea whilst the children sat on the grass.
